title: Failed to compile code with manual drop()

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code This code fails to compile under the `rustc` versions posted below. I tested it in the online version of the rust playground, which failed too. ```Rust fn assert_is_send(_: impl Send) {} struct NonSendThing(*const ()); async fn do_task() {} fn main() { let x = async { let x = NonSendThing(std::ptr::null()); drop(x); do_task().await; }; assert_is_send(x); } ``` Changing the code slightly, yields a different result (i.e. it compiles): ```rust fn assert_is_send(_: impl Send) {} struct NonSendThing(*const ()); async fn do_task() {} fn main() { let x = async { { let x = NonSendThing(std::ptr::null()); } do_task().await; }; assert_is_send(x); } ``` Therefore, I believe there is a bug in the compiler related with either move or drop semantics. As far as I can tell, this code fails to compile because the resulting`GenFuture` includes the state of a `!Send` variable in itself, when it is not necessary (the `!Send` value should be dropped before the `.await`). ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.55.0 (c8dfcfe04 2021-09-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: c8dfcfe046a7680554bf4eb612bad840e7631c4b commit-date: 2021-09-06 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.55.0 LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` `rustc +nightly --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0-nightly (003d8d3f5 2021-10-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: 003d8d3f56848b6f3833340e859b089a09aea36a commit-date: 2021-10-04 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: future cannot be sent between threads safely --> a.rs:13:5 | 1 | fn assert_is_send(_: impl Send) {} | ---- required by this bound in `assert_is_send` ... 13 | assert_is_send(x); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ future created by async block is not `Send` | = help: within `impl Future`, the trait `Send` is not implemented for `*const ()` note: future is not `Send` as this value is used across an await --> a.rs:11:9 | 9 | let x = NonSendThing(std::ptr::null()); | - has type `NonSendThing` which is not `Send` 10 | drop(x); 11 | do_task().await; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ await occurs here, with `x` maybe used later 12 | }; | - `x` is later dropped here error: aborting due to previous error ```
